page.title: 11FARLEY MOUNT,SPARSHOLT.
page.content: Farley Mount Country Park covers a large area.It has lots of trees and fields in it.There are also lots of wild flowers which include cowslips, bluebells,primroses and many more. There are lots of steep slopes. The monument itself was put there in memory of a horse who fell down a twenty five foot deep chalk pit.This happened in 1733.It stands on Beacon Hill which is the highest point in the area.This hill was used to light fires on as a warning system.In 1977 a fire was lit to celebrate Queen Elizabeth 2nd's Silver Jubilee. On a clear day you can see Salisbury Cathedral spire from here. The Forrestry Commission manage this park which is near to Crab Wood.
